sections.heading: First Person Pronouns
sections.content:
First person pronouns in Japanese vary by formality, gender, and context. Unlike English's single "I," Japanese has multiple options including 私 (watashi), 僕 (boku), 俺 (ore), and others. Choice depends on the speaker's gender, relationship with listener, and situation.

私は学生です (formal/neutral) "I am a student" 僕は学生だ (casual male) "I am a student" 俺は学生だ (very casual male) "I am a student"

children.heading: Most common and safe
children.content: 私は田中です "I am Tanaka" 私は日本人です "I am Japanese" Used by: Everyone Formality: Formal to neutral Gender: Neutral Situation: Any formal context

children.heading: Characteristics
children.content: Most formal "I" Safe in any situation Used in business Standard in writing Both men and women No negative connotations Default choice

children.heading: When to use
children.content: ✓ Business situations ✓ Formal occasions ✓ Meeting strangers ✓ Academic settings ✓ Official documents ✓ Public speaking Always appropriate

children.heading: Casual to polite male pronoun
children.content: 僕は学生です "I am a student" 僕の名前は太郎です "My name is Taro" Used by: Males (mainly) Formality: Casual to polite Gender: Male-associated Situation: Casual-friendly

children.heading: Characteristics
children.content: Casual but polite Young to middle-aged men Friendly atmosphere Not too rough Can use with です/ます Modest, softer than 俺 Common male choice

children.heading: When to use
children.content: ✓ Among friends ✓ With colleagues (casual) ✓ Daily conversation ✓ School/university ✓ Casual business Not appropriate: ✗ Very formal occasions ✗ Job interviews (usually) ✗ Official documents

children.heading: Rough, masculine "I"
children.content: 俺は行く "I'm going" 俺の車 "My car" Used by: Males only Formality: Very casual Gender: Masculine Situation: Informal only

children.heading: Characteristics
children.content: Very casual/rough Strong, masculine Close friends Family members Never in formal settings Can sound aggressive Most casual male form

children.heading: When to use
children.content: ✓ Close male friends ✓ Family (informal) ✓ Very casual settings ✓ Among peers Never use: ✗ Work settings ✗ With superiors ✗ Strangers ✗ Formal occasions ✗ With women (usually)

children.heading: Casual feminine pronoun
children.content: あたし、嬉しい "I'm happy" あたしの友達 "My friend" Used by: Females (young) Formality: Casual Gender: Feminine Situation: Informal

children.heading: Characteristics
children.content: Young women Cute, feminine speech Casual conversation Not in formal settings More casual than 私 Feminine identifier

children.heading: When to use
children.content: ✓ Among female friends ✓ Casual conversation ✓ Informal settings Avoid: ✗ Professional settings ✗ Formal occasions ✗ Business contexts

sections.heading: 私 (わたくし - watakushi) - Very Formal

children.heading: Ultra-formal first person
children.content: わたくしは田中と申します "I am called Tanaka" Used by: Anyone Formality: Very formal Gender: Neutral Situation: Official/ceremonial

children.heading: When to use
children.content: ✓ Formal speeches ✓ Official ceremonies ✓ Very polite situations ✓ Service industry (sometimes) Extremely polite Rarely used in daily life

children.heading: Casual masculine "we"
children.content: 僕らは学生だ "We are students" 俺らは行く "We're going" Plural casual forms Male-oriented Informal situations

children.heading: Standard "we"
children.content: 私たちは学生です "We are students" 私たちの学校 "Our school" Used by: Everyone Formality: Neutral to formal Gender: Neutral Situation: Standard Most common "we"

children.heading: Formal/official "we"
children.content: 我々は努力する "We will make efforts" Used by: Organizations, officials Formality: Very formal Gender: Neutral Situation: Official statements Formal speeches Written documents Organizational

children.heading: うち (uchi) - Kansai dialect
children.content: うち、知らんで "I don't know" (Kansai) Kansai region Casual, cute Female speakers mainly

children.heading: わし (washi) - Older men/dialect
children.content: わしは昔から "I, from the old days..." Older men Dialectal Traditional speech

children.heading: 自分 (jibun) - Various uses
children.content: 自分でやる "Do it myself" Reflexive "oneself" Regional "I" (Kansai) Military/sports

children.heading: Often unnecessary
children.content: With context: 学生です "(I) am a student" Full: 私は学生です "I am a student" Omission preferred When topic is clear Natural Japanese

children.heading: Adding たち
children.content: 私 → 私たち "we" 僕 → 僕たち "we" たち makes plural Standard method

children.heading: Adding ら
children.content: 僕 → 僕ら "we" 俺 → 俺ら "we" ら more casual Male-associated

children.heading: Male pronouns
children.content: 僕 (casual-polite) 俺 (very casual) わし (old men) Primarily male speakers Strong associations

children.heading: Female pronouns
children.content: あたし (casual-feminine) 私 (neutral, used by all) Women mainly use 私 あたし for casual/cute

children.heading: Neutral
children.content: 私 (watashi) Anyone can use No gender restriction Safest choice

children.heading: Decision factors
children.content: 1. Formality of situation 2. Your relationship with listener 3. Your gender 4. Context and setting 5. Age and social status Consider all factors

children.heading: Safe default
children.content: 私 (watashi) Always appropriate No risk of being rude Formal enough Neutral enough When in doubt, use 私

children.heading: Using 俺 in formal settings
children.content: Wrong: 俺は田中です (job interview) ⚠️ Correct: 私は田中です ✓ 俺 is too casual Use 私 for formal

children.heading: Overusing pronouns
children.content: Unnatural: 私は行く。私は食べる。⚠️ Natural: 行く。食べる。✓ Omit when clear More natural

children.heading: Women using 僕/俺
children.content: Generally avoid: 俺は... (female speaker) ⚠️ Standard: 私は... ✓ Gender associations matter Exceptions exist (tomboys, etc.)

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 私は学生です "I am a student" (neutral) 僕は田中だ "I'm Tanaka" (casual male) 俺は行く "I'm going" (very casual male) 私たちは日本人です "We are Japanese" (standard)

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 私は毎日日本語を勉強しています。 難しいですが、とても面白いです。 いつか日本に行きたいです。 "I study Japanese every day. It's difficult, but very interesting. I want to go to Japan someday." 僕は大学生だ。専攻は経済学。 将来は会社で働きたいと思っている。 今は一生懸命勉強している。 "I'm a university student. My major is economics. I'm thinking I want to work at a company in the future. Now I'm studying hard." 俺、昨日映画見たんだけど、 すごく面白かった。お前も 見に行けよ。 "I watched a movie yesterday, and it was really interesting. You should go see it too." (very casual male)
